newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian silver recovers by close, gold steady.
newsitem.headline: Indian silver recovers by close, gold steady.

text.p: Silver prices closed smartly higher after opening firm on Tuesday, aided by a recovery in the world market, dealers said.
"Fresh industrial support also helped," said a dealer. Silver was down 100 rupees per kg last week. The bullion market was closed on Monday for a Hindu festival.
Dealers said they would expect a further recovery in silver prices this week.
Gold opened higher and held steady in limited trading.
Gold biscuits (116.50 grammes each) were unchanged at 60,300 rupees. They were up 300 rupees last week.
